info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 12:52PM PDT until August 24 at 2:30PM PDT by NWS Hanford CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Kern.
* WHEN...Until 230 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1252 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Lake Cdp, Squirrel Mountain Valley, Weldon, Onyx and Mountain Mesa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON
